ETYMOLOGY: From Latin *discus* 'quoit, disc' (via Old French *disc* or Medieval Latin *discus*). The spelling 'disk' is a later variant, especially common in American English and computing contexts, while 'disc' is more common in British English and for optical/anatomical contexts.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A flat, thin, circular object or plate.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 扁平、薄、圆形的物体或板。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The decorative disk on the wall was made of polished metal.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 墙上的装饰性圆盘由抛光金属制成。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A round, flat medium on which data is recorded, such as a hard disk or floppy disk.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种圆形、扁平的介质，用于记录数据，例如硬盘或软盘。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I need to save these files to an external hard disk.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我需要将这些文件保存到一个外接硬盘上。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A pad of cartilage separating vertebrae in the spine.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 脊椎之间分隔椎骨的软骨垫。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He suffered from a herniated disk in his lower back.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他患有下背部椎间盘突出。
